00020 #ifndef CCNR_SYNC_DEFINED
00021 #define CCNR_SYNC_DEFINED
00022 
00023 #include "ccnr_private.h"
00024 
00025 /** Report message from sync code back through ccnr message infrastructure
00026  *
00027  */
00028 void r_sync_msg(struct sync_plumbing *sdd, const char *fmt, ...);
00029 
00030 /**
00031  * A call to r_sync_fence sets a "fence" marker that is remembered for any
00032  * clean shut down of a repo/sync pair.
00033  */
00034 int r_sync_fence(struct sync_plumbing *sdd, uint64_t seq_num);
00035 
00036 /** Notify repo of starting point for new names to be passed to sync.
00037  * Use item = 0 as the initial value.
00038  * Following a call to r_sync_notify_after, the repository will call
00039  *    SyncNotifyContent(struct SyncBaseStruct *,
00040  *                      int enumeration,
00041  *                      ccnr_accession item,
00042  *                      struct ccn_charbuf *name);
00043  * periodically while there are no un-notified objects.
00044  *     enumeration is 0 for "time-based" notifications, or the value passed
00045  *          in when the enumeration was started.   This may not end up an int.
00046  *     if the call is for an explicit enumeration, and there are no more
00047  *     objects, name and content_comps will be NULL.
00048  * If SyncNotifyContent returns -1 then the active enumeration, or the
00049  * r_sync_notify_after() will be cancelled.
00050  */
00051 void
00052 r_sync_notify_after(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, ccnr_hwm item);
00053 
00054 /** Request that a SyncNotifyContent call is made for each content object
00055  *  matching the interest.
00056  *  returns -1 for error, or an enumeration number which will also be passed
00057  *      in the SyncNotifyContent
00058  */
00059 int
00060 r_sync_enumerate(struct sync_plumbing *sdd, struct ccn_charbuf *interest);
00061 
00062 /** Look up a content object that is stored locally in the repository
00063  * based on the supplied interest.
00064  * appends the content object to the content_ccnb.
00065  * returns 0 for success, -1 for error.
00066  */
00067 int
00068 r_sync_lookup(struct sync_plumbing *sdd, struct ccn_charbuf *interest,
00069               struct ccn_charbuf *content_ccnb);
00070 
00071 /** Look up a content object that is stored locally in the repository
00072  * based on the supplied interest.  Takes a ccnr handle instead of sync data.
00073  * appends the content object to the content_ccnb.
00074  * returns 0 for success, -1 for error.
00075  */
00076 int
00077 r_lookup(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, struct ccn_charbuf *interest,
00078               struct ccn_charbuf *content_ccnb);
00079 
00080 /**
00081  * Called when a content object is received by sync and needs to be
00082  * committed to stable storage by the repo.
00083  */
00084 enum ccn_upcall_res
00085 r_sync_upcall_store(struct sync_plumbing *sdd, enum ccn_upcall_kind kind,
00086                     struct ccn_upcall_info *info);
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * Called when a content object has been constructed locally by sync
00090  * and needs to be committed to stable storage by the repo.
00091  * returns 0 for success, -1 for error.
00092  */
00093 
00094 int
00095 r_sync_local_store(struct sync_plumbing *sdd, struct ccn_charbuf *content_cb);
00096 
00097 /**
00098  * A wrapper for the sync_notify method that takes a content entry.
00099  */
00100 int
00101 r_sync_notify_content(struct ccnr_handle *ccnr, int e, struct content_entry *content);
